WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic:
The long radical and the long kanji are the same!
This kanji also means leader, because the longer a person is, the better a leader they'll be. Or maybe it was... the longer they've been somewhere? Whatever, longness = leaderness, you know?
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: As long as you know the radical long, you know the kanji long as well.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You see a very long person. It's Mrs. Chou (ã¡ã‚‡ã†), who has made herself long, like her street. "I made myself long so I can watch more of the street, my domain. I'm the leader of these streets. Watch yourself not-long person," says Mrs. Chou.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Long isn't an idea that's easy to imagine in any specific sense, but you can try some other things too, as long as it gets associated with Mrs. Chou. For the most part, when you see a kanji with the radical é•· the reading will be ã¡ã‚‡ã†.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: An archaeologist comes across an animal leg and an animal horn.  Strangely the horn is as long as the leg, so he wonders what kind of animal it could've possibly been!
origin_of_ch_char_book: (é•·, é•¿, zhang, chang, older; long) An old man with his long hair is handling something skillfully. The old man is good at many things as a result of all his experience. The eastern people considered respect for the older person as one of the most important virtues, so they even didnâ€™t cut their hair because the hair is the remnant of the old parents. (è€, lao, old) describes an old person bending his back wearing an elaborate head-dress, and a child or a man bowing to him . Although this character is used as the old person now, the original meaning was a person of no ordinary status; an older bureaucrat.
humanum_full_description_en:
A golden inscription looks like an old man with long hair leaning on a cane (Ye Yusen, Liu Zhao, Liu Xinglong, Shen Pei). The original meaning is elder, old, and extended from long hair to length.

The initial meanings of the characters " long " and " old " are similar, because the elderly are synonymous with the elderly. Some glyphs omit the crutch shape. The crutch shape or corruption becomes a " dagger " shape. Zhongshan Wangdingâ€™s " Long " is added next to "ç«‹".

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the name of the country or place, as well as the name of the person and the name of the southern style (see Xu Zhongshu). Inscriptions on gold indicate long-lasting, and the wall of history: "Civil and Wu Chang Lai (Strong)", which represents the long-term foundation created by King Wen and King Zhou Wu. Zhongshan Wangding: "Long to be the lord of the people" means to be the monarch for a long time. It also means being older, Zhongshan Wangding: "Things are young girls (such as) long".

"Said Wen": "Long, long time. From Wu from the dagger. Wu, the meaning of lofty. Long time changes. The sound of death. The person who is dead is also dead. All the long belongings are from the long. The ancient text is long. , Also the ancient prose."
humanum_short_description_en: Jia Jinwen is like a long-haired old man with a cane. The original meaning is the elderly, the elderly.

    A golden inscription looks like an old man with long hair leaning on a cane (Ye Yusen, Liu Zhao, Liu Xinglong, Shen Pei). The original meaning is elder, old, and extended from long hair to length. The initial meanings of the characters " long" and " old" are similar, because the elderly are synonymous with the elderly. Some glyphs omit the crutch shape. The crutch shape or corruption becomes a " dagger" shape. Zhongshan Wangdingâ€™s " Long" is added next to " ç«‹". The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the name of the country or place, as well as the name of the person and the name of the southern style (see Xu Zhongshu). Inscriptions on gold indicate long-lasting, and the wall of history: "Civil and Wu Chang Lai (Strong)", which represents the long-term foundation created by King Wen and King Zhou Wu. Zhongshan Wangding: "Long to be the lord of the people" means to be the monarch for a long time. It also means being older, Zhongshan Wangding: "Things are young girls (such as) long". "Said Wen": "Long, long time. From Wu from the dagger. Wu, the meaning of lofty. Long time changes. The sound of death. The person who is dead is also dead. All the long belongings are from the long. The ancient text is long. , Also the ancient prose."

    Radicals: é•·  (long)
    Meaning Mnemonic
    The long radical and the long kanji are the same!
    This kanji also means leader, because the longer a person is, the better a leader they'll be. Or maybe it was... the longer they've been somewhere? Whatever, longness = leaderness, you know?
    As long as you know the radical long, you know the kanji long as well.
    Reading Mnemonic
    You see a very long person. It's Mrs. Chou (ã¡ã‚‡ã†), who has made herself long, like her street. "I made myself long so I can watch more of the street, my domain. I'm the leader of these streets. Watch yourself not-long person," says Mrs. Chou.
    Long isn't an idea that's easy to imagine in any specific sense, but you can try some other things too, as long as it gets associated with Mrs. Chou. For the most part, when you see a kanji with the radical é•· the reading will be ã¡ã‚‡ã†.
